public int getPartyhat() { int[] partyhats = { 1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048 }; return partyhats[new Random().nextInt(partyhats.length)]; }

item.title: Mystery Box
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“OGolemX, post:10, topic:481511”]Try something close to this…

public int givepartyhat;

Public void randompartyhat () {
givepartyhat = misc.random(5);
if (givepartyhat == 0)
additem (1046, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 1)
addItem (1038, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 2)
additem (1040, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 3)
additem (1042, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 4)
additem (1044, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 5)
additem (1046, 1)

sendMessage(“you get a random partyhat”)
}
The code may not work but you have an example. Just make it so when you click the mystery box, it will do that “Void”

Like this
Case 3062:
(delete item code here)
randompartyhat();
}

That means it will do the public void.
Soz im not very good at explaining.
Dont copy this into your source it will not work, it is just an example for you that i quickly made from my ipod.[/quote]
or use an an array

dumbass

Read full topic

item.title: Mystery Box
item.dc:creator: @OGolemX OGolemX
item.description:
@OGolemX wrote:

Try something close to this…

public int givepartyhat;

Public void randompartyhat () {
givepartyhat = misc.random(5);
if (givepartyhat == 0)
additem (1046, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 1)
addItem (1038, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 2)
additem (1040, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 3)
additem (1042, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 4)
additem (1044, 1)

if (givepartyhat == 5)
additem (1046, 1)

sendMessage(“you get a random partyhat”)
}
The code may not work but you have an example. Just make it so when you click the mystery box, it will do that “Void”

Like this
Case 3062:
(delete item code here)
randompartyhat();
}

That means it will do the public void.
Soz im not very good at explaining.
Dont copy this into your source it will not work, it is just an example for you that i quickly made from my ipod.

item.title: Mystery Box
item.dc:creator: @Bluepike Bluepike
item.description:
@Bluepike wrote:

Hi, I’m trying to create a mystery box where players can get random items from. I’m getting the following compiler errors:

potions.java:15: error: cannot find symbol c.addItem(randomPartyHat(), 1); symbol: method randomPartyHat() location: class potions 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Here is what I’ve added in client.java

[code]public int randomPartyHat() {
int[] hats = {1038, 1040, 1042, 1044, 1046, 1048};
return hats[new Random().nextInt(.length)];

}[/code]

Here is what I’ve added in potions.java

case 3062: c.deleteItem(3062, c.getItemSlot(3062), 1); c.addItem(randomPartyHat(), 1); break;

Read full topic
